resources.string: Please update me from Play Store now.

Email us if you want to say something.

work@newfitlab.com (Designer, Newfit)
dnjscjf098@gmail.com (Developer, Illusion)
How about turning on Welcome Search? Go to settings if you want to activate it.
Data Saver is on. Please turn on Wi-Fi to use Welcome Search.
Please connect to network to use Welcome Search.
Search failed. Please check if you wrote model and CSC code correctly.
Still searching… Please wait for seconds
Check if model and CSC code is correctly saved in bookmark.
Before you search, you need to know model and CSC code.\nYour model is %s and I cannot inform your CSC code because I don\'t know which SIM card you use. You need to google your own CSC code.
Fantastic! You can see latest firmware information here.\nAmazing thing will happen if you click this card.
You can check previous firmwares here.
Basic search guide is over. You can enjoy CheckFirm now!

Firmware information consists of 3 information. Build version, CSC version, and baseband version.

Let's suppose that firmware search result is
A720SKSU3BRK1/A720SSKC3BRK1/A720NKOU3BRK1

First one(A720SKSU3BRK1) refers build version,
second one(A720SSKC3BRK1) refers CSC version,
last one(A720NKOU3BRK1) refers baseband version.
What do we know with firmware version?
All we need to care is build version. We can analyze firmware with build version.\nHere is example build version:
Red text (ex. U3) means bootloader version.\n\nDue to Samsung\'s security policy, you cannot downgrade from higher bootloader version firmware to lower bootloader version firmware.

Yellow text (ex. B) means Android OS version.
If yellow text is updated, it means Android OS is gonna be or has been updated.

A means very first Android OS version.
B means Android OS has been updated once.
C means Android OS has been updated twice.
.
.
.
Z means beta firmware.

Green text (ex. R) means year when firmware was built.

R means 2018,
S means 2019,
T means 2020, and so on.

Blue text (ex. K) means month when firmware was built.

A means January,
B means February,
.
.
.
L means December.

Purple text (ex. 1) means how many times firmware was built.

1 means firmware was built once.
.
.
.
9 means firmware was built 9 times.
A means firmware was built 10 times.
.
.
.
Z means firmware was built 35 times.
When will test firmware be released?
We cannot exactly assume it. But test firmware will be released soon if build version doesn\'t change more.
The latest version is already installed.

Official firmware information came from https://fota-cloud-dn.ospserver.net/firmware/(CSC)/(DEVICE)/version.xml.\nTest firmware information came from https://fota-cloud-dn.ospserver.net/firmware/(CSC)/(DEVICE)/version.test.xml.\nIt isn\'t the official way that Samsung Electronics provide firmware information to customers. Any use of this information is at your own risk.
Do all progresses that need Internet connection only when connected to Wi-Fi.
Please input device that you want to search on start.
Predict the latest test firmware. The result may not be correct if firmware information is encrypted.
This is not the accurate information from Samsung. This is just CheckFirm prediction.\nKeep in mind that this may differ from actual firmware.
Info Catcher will send you a notification when firmware has been updated.
When someone discovers new firmware, CheckFirm will send a notification to you automatically.\nPlease input device that you want to catch.
Info Catcher works properly when Smart Search is turned on. If you want to try Info Catcher, you have to enable Smart Search.
Please check if you wrote model and CSC code correctly.
